title: Loving Kindness
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: In this calming board book, with an inspiring loving kindness meditation for adults and kids to practice together, young readers can discover a meditation that inspires loving kindness.

title: Peaceful Mind
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: In this calming board book with a meditation exercise for adults and kids to practice together, young readers can discover breathwork and other tips on how to bring calm to a busy mind.

title: Voice for the Voiceless
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: His Holiness the Dalai Lama tells the full story of his struggle with China to save Tibet and its people for nearly seventy-five years.

title: Vajrayana and the Culmination of the Path - Library of Wisdom and Compassion Vol 10
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: The final volume the Dalai Lama takes us to the uncommon practices and realizations of Vajrayana to the full awakening of a buddha.

title: The Book of Compassion
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, Kailash Satyarthi, and Pooja Pande
description: "The Book of Compassion" brings together two Nobel Peace Prize Laureates, His Holiness the Dalai Lama and Kailash Satyarthi, along with writer Pooja Pande, to advocate for compassion in today's world.

title: Appearing and Empty - Library of Wisdom and Compassion Vol 9
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: In the ninth volume the Dalai Lama presents the analysis and meditations necessary to realize the ultimate nature of reality.

title: Science and Philosophy in the Indian Buddhist Classics, Vol. 4: Philosophical Topics
author: Conceived and Introduced by H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Thupten jinpa, Introductory Essay by Dechen Rochard
description: This fourth volume provides, through extensive passages, a window into the works of the great thinkers from the flowering of philosophy in classical India.

title: Heart to Heart
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Patrick McDonnell
description: From His Holiness the Dalai Lama and cartoonist and award-winning author Patrick McDonnell comes a powerful and timely gem of a book on how to heal our relationship with the planet and each other.

title: Science and Philosophy in the Indian Buddhist Classics, Vol. 3: Philosophical Schools
author: Conceived and Introduced by H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Thupten jinpa, Introductory Essay by Donald S Lopez Jr.
description: In this third volume the focus turns to exploring the philosophical schools of India.

title: Realizing the Profound View - Library of Wisdom and Compassion Vol 8
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: In the eighth volume the Dalai Lama presents the analysis and meditations necessary to realize the ultimate nature of reality.

title: The Little Book of Joy
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Archibishop Desmond Tutu, illustrated by Rafael Lopex
description: "The Little Book of Joy" picture book shows young readers how they can thrive and find joy, and why sharing joy with others makes it grow.

title: Searching for the Self - Library of Wisdom and Compassion Vol 7
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: In the seventh volume the Dalai Lama leads us go delve deeply into the topic of the ultimate nature of reality.

title: This Fragile Planet: His Holiness the Dalai Lama on Environment
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Michael Buckley
description: His Holiness the Dalai Lama's puts forth an ethical approach to dealing with the urgent issues of climate change and taking care of our delicate ecosystems.

title: Courageous Compassion - Library of Wisdom and Compassion Vol 6
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: In the sixth volume the Dalai Lama explores bodhisattvas’ activities across multiple Buddhist traditions—Tibetan, Theravāda, and Chinese Buddhism.

title: The Little Book of Encouragement
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Renuka Singh
description: His Holiness the Dalai Lama shares words of encouragement to deal with new realities in a pandemic stricken world.

title: Our Only Home - A Climate Appeal to the World
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Franz Alt
description: In a series of discussions with environmental journalist Franz Alt, His Holiness argues that we all need to stand up for a different, better and more climate-friendly world.

title: In Praise of Great Compassion - Library of Wisdom and Compassion Vol 5
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: In the fifth volume the Dalai Lama explores in depth just how central compassion and empathy are to the path to awakening.

title: Science and Philosophy in the Indian Buddhist Classics, Vol. 2: The Mind
author: Conceived and Introduced by H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Thupten Jinpa, and Contextual Essays by John D. Dunne
description: Explore the Buddhist view of consciousness—how it works and how it is transformed—in this unique sourcebook conceived by His Holiness the Dalai Lama,

title: Inner World
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Inner World is an album of mantras and teachings explaining that the real source of happiness is warm-heartedness and a concern for others, recited by His Holiness the Dalai Lama and set to music.

title: The Seed of Compassion: Lessons from the Life and Teachings of His Holiness the Dalai Lama
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, Bao Luu (Illustrator)
description: His Holiness the Dalai Lama addresses children directly, sharing lessons of peace and compassion, told through stories of his own childhood.

title: Following in the Buddha’s Footsteps - Library of Wisdom and Compassion Vol 4
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: The fourth volume of the Dalai Lama’s definitive series on the path to awakening where he presents the substance of spiritual practice - topics that form the core of Buddhist practice.

title: Samsara, Nirvana, and Buddha Nature - Library of Wisdom and Compassion Vol 3
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: The third volume in a multi-volume collection presenting the Dalai Lama’s comprehensive explanation of the role of the mind in samsara and the realization of nirvana, which is the mind's own ultimate nature.

title: The Life of My Teacher: A Biography of Kyabjé Ling Rinpoché
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: The Dalai Lama tells the life story of his remarkable teacher, Ling Rinpoché, who remained a powerful anchor for him from childhood and into his emergence as a global spiritual leader.

title: Ecology, Ethics, and Interdependence: The Dalai Lama in Conversation with Leading Thinkers on Climate Change
author: John Dunne and Daniel Goleman (editors)
description: Explores the nature of climate, and humans actions that change it; the nature of our minds, which give rise to these actions; and the individual and collective behaviors that could shift our actions from destructive to regenerative.

title: The Foundation of Buddhist Practice - The Library of Wisdom and Compassion Vol 2
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: The second volume in His Holiness the Dalai Lama’s definitive and comprehensive series on the stages of the Buddhist path contains the important teachings that will help us establish a flourishing Dharma practice.

title: A Call for Revolution
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Sofia-Stril-Rever
description: An appeal to young people of the world written from conversations with His Holiness the Dalai Lama, with solutions for our chaotic, aggressive, divided times.

title: Happiness
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: From the realization of mental peace to the experience of illness, suffering, death, pain, pleasure, desire and contentment, the Dalai Lama opens a window into the attainment of absolute happiness in day to day life.

title: Science and Philosophy in the Indian Buddhist Classics, Vol. 1: The Physical World
author: Conceived and Introduced by H.H. the Dalai Lama and edited by Thupten Jinpa
description: This series brings together classical Buddhist explorations of the nature of our material world and the human mind and puts them into context for the modern reader.

title: The Book of Joy Journal
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, Archbishop Desmond Tutu and Douglas Abrams
description: A companion to "The Book of Joy" with inspiring quotes from His Holiness the Dalai Lama and Archbishop Desmond Tutu to help find joy in our lives.

title: Approaching the Buddhist Path - LIbrary of Wisdom and Compassion Vol 1
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: The first volume in a multi-volume collection presenting the Dalai Lama’s comprehensive explanation of the Buddhist path contains introductory material that sets the context for Buddhist practice.

title: The Dalai Lama on Environment - Collected Statements 1987-2017
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: A compilation of excerpts from speeches and teachings by His Holiness the Dalai Lama on the importance of environmental protection delivered from 1987 through 2017.

title: The Book of Joy
author: H.H. The Dalai Lama and Archbishop Desmond Tutu with Douglas Abrams
description: In April 2015, His Holiness the Dalai Lama and Archbishop Desmond Tutu met in Dharamsala for a conversation about joy. The Book of Joy chronicles that discussion, and spreads the underlying message that to experience joy, you must bring joy to others.

title: The Heart of Meditation
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated and edited by Jeffrey Hopkins
description: His Holiness the Dalai Lama provides intimate details on an advanced meditation practice called Dzogchen using a visionary poem by the 19th-century saint Patrul Rinpoche, author of the Buddhist classic Words of My Perfect Teacher.

title: Buddhism: One Teacher, Many Traditions
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Ven Thubten Chodron
description: His Holiness the Dalai Lama and Venerable Thubten Chodron map out the convergence and divergence of the two major Buddhist movements—the Sanskrit traditions of Tibet and East Asia and the Pāli traditions of Sri Lanka and Southeast Asia.

title: A Force For Good: The Dalai Lama's Vision for Our World
author: Dan Goleman
description: Released to mark His Holiness the Dalai Lama’s 80th birthday, this book reveals his fresh, radically different perspective on creating a better future; a vision that can be assimilated by each and every one of us on the basis of our common humanity.

title: The Wisdom of Compassion
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Victor Chan
description: The Wisdom of Compassion offers rare insights into the Dalai Lama’s life and his efforts to translate compassion into action through deeply engaging, behind-the-scene stories about his interactions with remarkable people from all walks of life.

title: Beyond Religion: Ethics for a Whole World
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: In his book Ethics for a New Millennium, His Holiness the Dalai Lama first proposed an approach to ethics based on universal rather than religious principles. With Beyond Religion he elaborates and deepens his vision for the nonreligious way—a path to lead an ethical, happy, and spiritual life.

title: My Spiritual Autobiography
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama with Sofia Stril-rever
description: My Spiritual Journey provides a vivid and moving portrait of the Dalai Lama’s life journey that is personal in tone but universal in scope. He explores three phases or commitments of his spiritual life — as a human being, as a Buddhist monk, and as the Dalai Lama — each of which has made him more dedicated to exploring and teaching human values and inner happiness, promoting harmony among all religions, and advocating for the civil rights and well-being of the Tibetan people.

title: Toward a True Kinship of Faiths
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Toward a True Kinship of Faiths explores where differences between religions can be genuinely appreciated without serving as sources of conflict, as well as offers a hopeful yet realistic look at how humanity must step into the future.

title: The Middle Way - Faith Grounded in Reason
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Thubten Jinpa
description: In this book the Dalai Lama presents a brief, brilliant presentation of the view of reality in the Mahayana tradition of Buddhism.

title: Leaders' Way - Business, Buddhism and Happiness in an Interconnected World
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Laurens van den Muyzenberg
description: Born out of a decade of discussion and debate between an international management consultant and the head of state and spiritual leader of Tibet, the Leader's Way flows from the meeting of two worlds - that of the global market place and the Dalai Lama's world of Buddhism.

title: All You Ever Wanted to Know About Happiness, Life and Living
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, compiled by Rajiv Mehrotra
description: An edited compilation of mostly personal conversations spanning nearly 20 years between the Dalai Lama and author Rajiv Mehrotra

title: Art of Happiness in a Troubled World
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Howard C. Cutler
description: A sequel to the best-selling Art of Happiness.

title: Emotional Awareness
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Paul Ekman
description:
Emotional Awareness
by H.H. the Dalai Lama and Paul Ekman

In this unparalleled series of conversations, the Dalai Lama and Ekman prod and push toward answers to the central questions of emotional experience.

title: Becoming Enlightened
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated and edited by Jeffrey Hopkins
description: You do not have to suffer. You can break free from your past and can enjoy a wonderful future. This is the message the Dalai Lama offers us in this accessible guide along the path to enlightenment.

title: In My Own Words - An Introduction to My Teachings and Philosophy
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Rajiv Mehrotra
description:
In My Own Words - An Introduction to My Teachings and Philosophy
by H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Rajiv Mehrotra

An introduction to the general philosophy of the Dalai Lama drawn from a selection of extracts from his works and public talks, edited by Rajiv Mehrotra.

title: Dalai Lama at MIT
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Anne Harrington and Arthur Zajonc
description: A record of the meeting between the Dalai Lama and scientists at the recent prestigious MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology) conference, including both the papers given at the conference and the animated discussion and debate that followed.

title: Mind in Comfort and Ease - The Vision of Enlightenment in the Great Perfection
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: The Dalai Lama gives a brilliant overview of the path from the Dzogchen point of view, based on the classic Nyingma text Samten Ngalso by Longchenpa, from the Trilogy on Finding Comfort and Ease in Meditation on the Great Perfection (or Kindly Bent to Ease Us).

title: Activating Bodhichitta and a Meditation on Compassion
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Four texts on compassion: a bodhisattva's aspirational prayer by the Indian master Aryasura and its commentary by the second Dalai Lama; the Inseparability of the Spiritual Master and Avalokiteshvara; and a talk on activating compassion both by the present Dalai Lama.
publisher: Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamsala

title: Teachings on Je Tsong Khapa's Three Pincipal Aspects of the Path
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Ven. Lhakdor and edited by Jeremy Russell
description: A brief commentary by the Dalai Lama on Lama Tsong Khapa's Three Principal Aspects of the Path, containing the essence of the Buddha's path.
publisher: Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamsala

title: Yoga Tantra - Paths to Magical Seats
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, Dzong-ka-ba and Jeffery Hopkins
description: The Dalai Lama opens the door to the topic of Yoga Tantra with an extraordinarily detailed teaching on a classic text.

title: The Universe in a Single Atom - The Convergence of Science and Spirituality
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: After forty years of study with some of the greatest scientific minds as well as a lifetime of meditative, spiritual and philosophical study, the Dalai Lama presents a brilliant analysis of why both disciplines must be pursued in order to arrive at a complete picture of the truth.

title: Widening the Circle of Love
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated and edited by Jeffrey Hopkins
description:
Widening the Circle of Love
by H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated and edited by Jeffrey Hopkins

As human beings, we are born to love but we may not know how to do so unconditionally. In this book, His Holiness the Dalai Lama explains how we each possess enormous potential to grow in love.

title: Art of Happiness at Work
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Howard C. Cutler
description: A sequel to the best-selling Art of Happiness, this book focuses on transforming dissatisfaction at work, and the Buddhist concept of Right Livelihood.

title: Lighting the Path, Teachings on Wisdom and Compassion
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Geshe Tubten Jinpa
description: This concise and accessible presentation of the path of Tibetan Buddhism by the Dalai Lama shows how to apply basic Buddhist principles in our lives.

title: Path of Wisdom, Path of Peace - A Personal Conversation
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Felizitas Von Schoenborn
description: This is a unique book of the Dalai Lama's thought on how he sees himself, Buddhism, the world at war, the meaning of freedom, busy modern life, its challenges and how to master them.

title: Many Ways to Nirvana
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Wise advice on many subjects, including the need to overcome negative emotions in order to develop your inner consciousness.

title: The Wisdom of Forgiveness
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Victor Chan
description: One of the most intimate and personal conversations yet published with the Dalai Lama.

title: Dzogchen: Heart Essence of the Great Perfection
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: These teachings on Dzogchen, the heart essence of the ancient Nyingma tradition of Tibetan Buddhism, were given by the Dalai Lama to Western students.

title: New Physics and Cosmology - Dialogues with the Dalai Lama
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, Arthur Zajonc and Zara Houshmand
description: An intriguing dialogue on the implications of the discoveries in quantum physics and cosmology between scientists and the Dalai Lama.

title: Practicing Wisdom - The Perfection of Shantideva's Bodhisattva Way
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translation by Geshe Tubten Jinpa
description: A commentary by the Dalai Lama on Shantideva's final chapter on wisdom from the Guide to the Bodhisattva's Way of Life, drawing on contrasting Nyingma and Gelug school viewpoints.

title: Destructive Emotions
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Daniel Goleman
description: A common challenge for humanity lies at the heart of this book, which documents a collaboration between the Dalai Lama and a group of scientists focusing on human behaviour and understanding and countering destructive emotions.

title: The Compassionate Life
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Collected here for the first time are four of the Dalai Lama`s most accessible and inspiring teachings on compassion.

title: Warm Heart Open Mind
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Comprising talks given while the Dalai Lama was in New Zealand in 2002, this book promotes the basic human values of love, tolerance, compassion, forgiveness and self-discipline.
publisher: The Dalai Lama Trust, New Zealand

title: 365 - Dalai Lama Daily Advice from the Heart
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Mathieu Ricard
description: Short passages of inspirational advice for everyday living - one for every day of the year.

title: Heart of Compassion
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: A practical guide to an understanding of our human condition and how we can act to achieve a higher fulfilment than purely worldly enjoyment, creating a life of harmony, peace and virtue.

title: Healing Emotions - Conversation with the Dalai Lama on Emotions and Health
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: The record of an extraordinary encounter between the Dalai Lama and Buddhist teachers and Western psychologists, physicians and scientists on the mind's uncanny ability to heal the body.

title: Advice on Dying
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated and edited by Jeffrey Hopkins
description: In this empowering and positive book the Dalai Lama presents teachings on preparing for our inevitable death which can greatly benefit our perspective on living.

title: Essence of the Heart Sutra
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: A commentary by the Dalai Lama on the Heart Sutra. This book includes the complete text of the Heart of Wisdom teachings given by the Dalai Lama in California in 2001.

title: How to Practice
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated and edited by Jeffrey Hopkins
description: As human beings we possess one common desire: the need for happiness and a meaningful life. In this book the Dalai Lama offers guidance for developing a daily practice in the quest to find true fulfilment.

title: Illuminating the Path to Enlightenment
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: The Dalai Lama gives a commentary to Atisha's seminal text, a Lamp for the Path to Enlightenment, and Lama Tsong Khapa's Lines of Experience.

title: Pocket Dalai Lama
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, compiled and edited by Mary Craig
description: A miniature compendium of inspirational wisdom from the collected works of the Dalai Lama.

title: An Open Heart
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Nicholas Vreeland
description: How does one actually become a compassionate person? What are the mechanisms by which a selfish heart is transformed into a generous heart? Here is a series of meditations used for this purpose.
publisher: Little Brown and Company, New York

title: Stages of Meditation
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Geshe Lobsang Jordhen, Lobsang Choephel Ganchenpa and Jeremy Russell
description: A commentary to Kamalashila's quintessential meditation manual, Stages of Meditation. The Dalai Lama describes the nature of mind and how to train in it to achieve calm abiding - perfect clarity and mental stability - and penetrative insight into reality.

title: The Transformed Mind - Reflections on Truth, Love and Happiness
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: A compilation of lectures delivered by the Dalai Lama at the Dharma Celebrations held annually at Tushita centre in Delhi.

title: The Meaning of Life - Bhuddhist Perspectives on Cause and Effect
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated and edited by Jeffrey Hopkins
description: Instructions on Buddhist philosophy given by the Dalai Lama in London in 1984.

title: A Simple Path
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: The Dalai Lama outlines Buddhism and the four noble truths, and introduces the landscape and culture of Tibet through the photographs of Ian Cumming.

title: Transforming the Mind
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Dr. Thupten Jinpa, edited by Dominique Side & Dr. Thupten Jinpa
description: Based on a commentary to Geshe Langri Tangpa's Eight Verses of Thought Transformation given in London in 1999.

title: The Little Book of Wisdom
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: A handy pocket-sized book in which the Dalai Lama offers insights on daily living, inner peace, compassion and justice.

title: Dalai Lama's Book of Wisdom
author: Dalai Lama, edited by Matthew Bunson
description: The Dalai Lama's perspective on peace, love, religion, justice, social issues and the environment. This collection taken from his talks offers encouragement to all those eager to seek a more peaceful and liberating way of life.

title: Buddha Heart, Buddha Mind - Living the Four Noble Truths
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: his book contains eight talks given by the Dalai Lama in France at Institut Karma Ling in 1997, in which he expounded particularly on the Four Noble Truths of the Buddha.

title: Essential Teachings
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Truly inspiring commentaries by the Dalai Lama on the Thirty-Seven Practices of a Bodhisattva, and how these can be applied, plus Key of Madhyamika.

title: Ancient Wisdom, Modern World - Ethics for a New Millennium
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: The by the Dalai Lama, in which he calls for a spiritual revolution. With wit, insight and good sense he demonstrates that there are universal principles we can draw on which transcend the dilemma of belief and disbelief.

title: Consciousness at the Crossroads - Conversations with the Dalai Lama on Brain Science and Buddhism
author: Conversations with the Dalai Lama on Brain Science and Buddhism
description: Addressing many fundamental questions that have divided western science and religion for centuries, this book arose out of meetings between the Dalai Lama, neuroscientists and psychiatrists.

title: The Heart of the Buddha's Path
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Dr. Thupten Jinpa, edited by Dominique Side & Dr. Thupten Jinpa
description: The Dalai Lama describes in clear and simple terms how to bring wisdom and compassion into our daily lives.

title: The Little Book of Buddhism
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, compiled and edited by Renuka Singh
description: Thought-provoking quotations about the importance of love and compassion and the need for individual responsibility.

title: Eight Verses for Training the Mind
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: His Holiness's explanation of Lojong.

title: Introduction to Buddhism
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: A brief introduction to Buddhism followed by a simplified practice of tantric meditation especially designed for Western non-initiates.

title: Imagine All the People - The Dalai Lama on Money, Politics and Life as it Coud Be
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama with Fabian Quaki
description: Fabien Ouaki, a prominent French businessman, asks the Dalai Lama for his thoughts on the everyday issues that fill our media and our lives.

title: The Power of Buddhism
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama ahd Jean-Claude Carriere
description: The Dalai Lama has spoken extensively about the practice of Tibetan Buddhism, but he has never before directly addressed Buddhism's response to humanity's challenges in approaching this millennium as he does in these dialogues.

title: The Art of Happiness
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama & Howard C. Cutler
description: A guide to achieving happiness, written with contemporary western preoccupations in mind.

title: The Four Noble Truths
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Dr. Thupten Jinpa, edited by Dominique Side & Dr. Thupten Jinpa
description: From HH the Dalai Lama's first teaching in the west on 'The Four Noble Truths'– the heart of the Buddhist’s teachings.

title: The Path to Tranquillity - Daily Meditations
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, compiled and edited by Renuka Singh

title: The Political Philosophy of His Holiness the Dalai Lama - Selected Speeches and Writings
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by A.A. Shiromany
publisher: Tibetan Parliamentary and Policy Research Center, New Delhi

title: Spiritual Advice for buddhists and Christians
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: The Dalai Lama speaks on four major themes in spirituality: prayer and meditation; the stages in the process of spiritual development; the role of the teacher and the community; and the spiritual goals of personal and social transformation.

title: The Gelug/Kagyu Tradition of Mahamudra
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama & Alexander Berzin
description: This book presents an exceptional commentary on the First Panchen Lama's text on Mahamudra that uses Kagyu-style techniques for recognizing the conventional nature of the mind, and typical Gelug methods in recognizing its deepest nature.

title: Healing Anger - The Power of Patience from a Buddhist Perspective
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Dr. Thupten Jinpa
description: Techniques and methods for developing patience that are very relevant to Buddhists and to everyone seeking to improve themselves based on the section on patience from the 'Guide to the Bodhisattvas Way of Life' by the Indian master Shantideva.

title: The Joy of Living and Dying in Peace
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by John Avedon & Donald S. Lopez
description: The third in the popular Library of Tibet series, this book addresses the universal questions of how we can achieve meaningful lives and peaceful deaths.

title: Love, Kindness and Universal Responsibility
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: This compilation of three previous works reveals the philosophy of His Holiness, based on the concept of universal responsibility and reverence for all living beings.

title: Sleeping, Dreaming and Dying
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited and narrated by Francisco Varela
description: For the modern scientist, the transitional states of sleeping, dreaming and dying lie at the forefront of research in cognitive science, neurology and psychology, and for the Buddhist practitioner these same states represent crucial opportunities to transform consciousness itself.

title: Buddha Nature
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: The Buddhist leader explains his ideas of nirvana and presents the complex concept of buddha nature in the perspective of Christian ideas of self, immortality and an eternal soul.

title: Beyond Dogma
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: During a series of public lectures and question-and-answer sessions with political activists, religious leaders, students, scientists, Buddhist practitioners, and interfaith organizations, His Holiness responds to a wider range of contemporary social, political, and religious issues.

title: The Good Heart - A Buddhist Perspective on the Teachings of Jesus
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: The Dalai Lama provides an extraordinary Buddhist perspective on the teachings of Jesus, commenting on well-known passages from the four Christian Gospels including the Sermon on the Mount, the parable of the mustard seed, the Resurrection, and others.

title: Awakening the Mind, Lightening the Heart
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by John Avedon & Donald S. Lopez
description: The Dalai Lama details the original Kadampa mind transformation methods, basing his treatment on Namkha Pel's Mind Training Like the Rays of the Sun, which takes the practitioner through the processes of generating the aspirational mind of enlightenment.

title: Commentary on the Thirty Seven Practices of a Bodhisattva
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Acharya Nyima Tsering, edited by Vyvyan Cayley and Mike Gilmore
description: One of Tibetan Buddhism's most popular texts, incorporating mind training and Lam-rim teachings. His Holiness elucidates each stanza and gives introductory talks on living one's Buddhism.
publisher: Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamsala

title: Dialogues on Universal Responsibility and Education
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Two workshops held in Delhi between the Dalai Lama and a group of Indian scholars, philosophers, teachers and social reformers.
publisher: Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamsala

title: His Holiness the Dalai Lama Speeches Statements Articles Interviews from 1987 to June 1995
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
publisher: Department of Information and International Relations, Dharamsala

title: The Path to Enlightenment
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated & edited by Glenn H. Mullin
description: he Dalai Lama provides an extensive teaching on the path to enlightenmen drawing out the meaning of the Third Dalai Lama's famous 'Essence of Refined Gold' .

title: The Power of Compassion
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Drawing upon contemporary themes, the Dalai Lama offers timeless knowledge to give readers courage to face the confusion and suffering of the world and bring wisdom and compassion into their lives.

title: The Spirit of Tibet: Universal Heritage - Selected Speeches and Writings
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by A.A. Shiromany, Tibetan Parliamentary Center
publisher: Tibetan Parliamentary and Policy Research Center, New Delhi

title: The Way to Freedom
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by John Avedon & Donald S. Lopez
description: An essential primer on Tibetan Buddhism for both beginners and advanced students, based on the Lam Rim teachings. It covers refuge, karma, death, rebirth, the Four Noble Truths, and the bodhisattva ideal and deeds.

title: The World of Tibetan Buddhism
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated, edited and annotated by Dr. Thupten Jinpa
description:
The World of Tibetan Buddhism
by H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated, edited and annotated by Dr. Thupten Jinpa

In this book the Dalai Lama explains in brief but lucid detail every aspect of the Tibetan Buddhist path to enlightenment.

title: A Flash of Lightning in the Dark of Night
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: His Holiness presents here a detailed manual of practical philosophy based on the Bodhicharyavatara by Shantideva.

title: Words of Truth
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama

title: Generous Wisdom - Commentaries on the Jatakamala
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Discourses on the 'Jatakamala: Garland of Birth Stories of Buddha', given during the Great Prayer Festival in Dharamsala
publisher: Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamsala

title: Worlds in Harmony
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama with conference participants
description: The age-old insights of Buddhism meet modern western psychological theory.

title: Gentle Bridges - Conversations with the Dalai Lama on the Sciences of the Mind
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, Jeremy Hayward and Francisco Verela
description: A chronicle of the groundbreaking meeting between prominent Western scientists and the Dalai Lama.

title: Cultivating a Daily Meditation
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Two discourses covering the essential points of Buddhism and providing a clear and simple method to cultivate a daily practice of meditation.
publisher: Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamsala

title: Mind Science - An East - West Dialogue
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama with Herbert Benson, Robert A. Thurman, Howard E. Gardner, Daniel Goleman
description: A record of the historic dialogue between modern science and Buddhism in which the Dalai Lama and other Indo-Tibetan scholars met with leading authorities from the fields of medicine, psychiatry, psychology, biology, neurobiology and education.

title: Path to Bliss
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Beginning with practices that develop an effective mental outlook in one's life, this book guides the student to more advanced techniques for developing the mind's deepest potential and happiness.

title: Freedom in Exile
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Following his award of the Nobel Peace Prize, this is the autobiography in which the Dalai Lama talks freely of his life and the tragic story of Tibet, and also discusses contemporary issues.

title: The Global Community & the Need for Universal Responsibility
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama

title: My Tibet
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama & Galen Rowell
description: Personal reflections to match incredibly beautiful photographs of the land the Dalai Lama was forced to flee in 1959.

title: The Nobel Peace Prize and the Dalai Lama
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, compiled & edited by Sidney Piburn

title: Policy of Kindness
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, compiled & edited by Sidney Piburn
description: The engaging and popular book offering a comprehensive view of the Dalai Lama.

title: Ocean Of Wisdom
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Sayings, thoughts and inspirations that guide towards creating a positive attitude towards one's self and others.

title: The Bodhgaya Interviews
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, edited by Jose Ignacio Cabezon
description: Interviews with The Dalai Lama in Bodhgaya on various topics such as politics, Christianity, particle physics, tantra, emptiness and liberation.

title: The Dalai Lama at Harvard
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated and edited by Jeffery Hopkins
description: A series of lectures given by the Dalai Lama at Harvard University, not just providing an introduction to Buddhist theory but covering a wide spectrum of important issues.

title: Transcendent Wisdom
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated, edited & annotated by B. Alan Wallace
description: This extraordinary clear exposition is based on an oral teaching given by the Dalai Lama in India in 1979 on Shantideva's Guide to the Bodhisattva's Way of Life's ninth chapter, the section on transcendent wisdom.

title: The Union of Bliss & Emptiness
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Dr. Thupten Jinpa
description: An illuminating and profound commentary by the Dalai Lama on the Gelugpa Lama Chopa guru yoga.

title: Tantra in Tibet
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, Tshongkhapa and Jeffrey Hopkins
description: Consists of three parts: The Dalai Lama's 'Essence of Tantra', Tsong Khapa's 'Great Exposition of Secret Mantra', and a supplement by Jeffrey Hopkins.

title: Kalachakra Tantra - Rite of Initiation
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama and Jeffrey Hopkins
description: In his definitive introduction to Buddhism's most esoteric and popular tantra, the Dalai Lama explains the process of initiation into what is also Buddhism's most complex system of practice, often given over three days and to very large assemblies of devotees.

title: Opening of the Eye of New Awareness
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Donald S. Lopez with Jeffrey Hopkins
description: A succinct yet thorough presentation of the doctrines of Tibetan Buddhism written by the Dalai Lama, 'for those who do not have the leisure to study the great texts, profound and full of impact.'

title: Opening the Mind and Generating a Good Heart
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: A concise survey of Buddhist training explaining how generating kindness is the core of the Buddha's teaching.
publisher: Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamsala

title: Kindness, Clarity and Insight
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated and edited by Jeffery Hopkins
description: A warm and inspiring collection of talks, not limited to Buddhists or to the religious, the Dalai Lama's direct, practical message speaks to people everywhere of the importance of kindness, love, and compassion.

title: Advice from Buddha Shakyamuni
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: A brief outline and commentary on the discipline to be observed by a fully ordained Tibetan Buddhist monk, based on the intermediary verses of the Vinaya.
publisher: Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamsala

title: Four Essential Buddhist Commentaries
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Commentaries on the 37 Bodhisattva Practices, the 3 Principles of the Path, the 8 Verses on Mind Training and the Song of 4 Mindfulnesses.
publisher: Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamsala

title: Deity Yoga
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, Tshongkhapa and Jeffrey Hopkins
description: A continuation of Tantra in Tibet, with a commentary by the Dalai Lama. Focusing on the practice of deity yoga, it describes the profound process of meditation in the Action and Performance Tantras.

title: Universal Responsibility and the Good Heart
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: A collection of articles and interviews with the Dalai Lama reflecting his thoughts and activities over the past twenty years.
publisher: Library of Tibetan Works & Archives, Dharamsala

title: The Buddhism of Tibet and the Key to the Middle Way
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama, translated by Jeffrey Hopkins, Lati Rinpoche and Anne Carolyn Klein
description: Unlike most books by the Dalai Lama which are edited compilations of talks that he has given, this book consists of two texts that he himself wrote and two that he chose.

title: The Opening of the Wisdom Eye
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: Mahayana Buddhism explained by the spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhism.

title: My Land and My People
author: H.H. the Dalai Lama
description: The dignified and compelling early autobiography of the Dalai Lama, spiritual and temporal leader of Tibet.
